content.label: My favorite iOS game of all time and I play a lot of them. I play a few games of Threes almost every day.
I keep coming back to this one. Works great on XS Max.
I’ve probably played every day for just over four years. I love this game and actually find it very calming.

Some recent changes in the algorithm has made it stupid otherwise which was one of the greatest puzzle game ever. Five consecutive 1s or 2s in middle of the game? Seriously!

I am not a pro but playing against it was fun. But now it seems like there's very low chance to make a big score since it gives a series of consecutive numbers to put me in a corner. I know it will try to beat me but there's no fair play anymore? Is it justified to provide five 1s/2s in a row? It's happening every time for the past few weeks.

Not good. Losing interest.

Some recent changes in the algorithm has made it stupid otherwise which was one of the greatest puzzle game ever. Five consecutive 1s or 2s in middle of the game? Seriously!

I am not a pro but playing against it was fun. But now it seems like there's very low chance to make a big score since it gives a series of consecutive numbers to put me in a corner. I know it will try to beat me but there's no fair play anymore? Is it justified to provide five 1s/2s in a row? It's happening every time for the past few weeks.

Not good. Losing interest.

title.label: Yes this is based on a number theorem.

content.label: You will never achieve anything other than the displayed highest quantity.  It’s  a fun principle too bad they didn’t  associate it with Pi , it would have been eternal. But since people are idiots so are developers.

Yo there’s this glitch on the X where if you are playing the game and then swipe out of the game, the next time you go back into the game it automatically swipes up. As someone who builds bottom left, this is, as you can imagine, very frustrating. I’m on the verge of tears rn, I was about to get my first Volleo, and I went to text my friend.. and ... and well.. I don’t wanna talk about it. Lol jk but ya the glitch actually does happen also great game also this is probably an ineffective way to complain about a glitch idk threesus help me by the power of the holy Trin

title.label: Definitely the most played game on my phone

content.label: Ive spent so much time playing this game it’s great! I love the challenge and have become very good with it. I can think of a single problem 😃
Great soundtrack, challenging gameplay.

title.label: I always go back to Threes

content.label: I’ve had this game for years, literally years, since it first came out on iOS. I’ve downloaded and played many mobile games but this game never gets deleted, I love the style, colors, the music, the satisfying feeling of squishing numbers together. It’s so well designed, works with no internet connection (great for subway commutes) and that’s part of why I keep going back to it. I’ve played this through three phone generations - iPhone 4s, 5s, and now on my 6s. This is hands down the best mobile game purchase I’ve made, considering how many hours (years!) I’ve put in to it, and it never gets old.

I have had this game for at least a couple years and it is still interesting! Every game is a new challenge, while still following the same easy rules. Lots of fun and short enough individual games to be easy to play anytime you have a moment.

Been a while since I played it, but I liked what they said next to an update so decided to give a review. Game play is hard to describe, pretty fast moving, very odd soundtrack you might love or loathe (but can always silence it).  I am pretty cranky and uninstall many games but have kept this one for some time.  Give it a try!  Plan on some learning curve.

title.label: Awesome game, always come back to it

content.label: I’ve owned this game for years now. I take breaks but always come back. A joy to play, and my wife and I frequently greet each other with a “hello” in the voice of these adorable little guys.

title.label: A small mobile app turned into my favorite game of all time

content.label:
Threes is a brilliant little game. The concept and execution of this is outstanding. It's cute, friendly, has amazing style and one of the best game soundtracks ever. It's one of the few games I play with full audio.

I've put in thousands of hours into this game, and every month I keep improving and finding new ways to increase my scores. It has an amazing learning curve that anyone with over a Triferatu under their belt will know. Getting a Volleo might've been my greatest gaming achievement, and this is coming from a big console game.

I've been playing this game since its release in 2014, and I haven't stopped since. I cannot think of a single game, mobile or console, that I've fallen this much in love with. 5/5.

This is a great "waiting" game, perfect for when you're waiting for something and you don't want to get too deeply engaged. I especially like the night feature, making this the best game for me to play while nursing my kid to sleep.
Thanks!
In 2018, it’s still the best iOS game.

Threes spawned several generations of clones because it’s such an original, simple, and pure concept, like Pong or Tetris.

The clones all pale in comparison however, because Threes also has the kind of nuance that only comes with the intricate iterative design of an original concept by its inventors.

Try a game of 2048 and make random gestures without looking at the screen and see how far you get. Try it in Threes and you’ll quickly realize this game requires thought and planning far beyond its clones in order to succeed.
This game is relaxing and helps me decompress after a long day

title.label: One of the best iOS games of all time

content.label: If I had to choose the best iOS games of all time, Threes would surly be on the list. Challenging, relaxing and well designed. What more could you ask for? I have 3,025 games logged. Here’s to many more.

“Hello ladies and gentlemen!”

This is Threejay. By far my favorite Threes tile so far. I’ve only made it to 384 and the home-screen for the game shows there are four more tiles to collect. 

I remember paying for this game and don’t remember how much, but so far with over 100 games played, I’d say it’s been worth it. Every once in a while Threejay gives some excellent affirmation from Joe Esposito’s classic song featured in Karate Kid — “You’re the best around!” The giggles induced by that interjection inspire enough for this wandering wordy review. 

Thanks, Sirvo! 

PS: Using Night Colors is the best way to play :)
There is no way to win and it makes you so angy😠😠😠😠😠😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😈😈

I like this game but I’m not happy with the new screen the pops up every time the game ends and asks me to sign my score. Make that go away. When a game ends I just want to start a new one with no extra steps. 

Also, I agree with others who have mentioned the frequent appearance of 4-6 all red or all blue blocks in a row, which is extremely difficult to work around.

Sure, I may be addicted, and there's no going back, but I've accepted it with pride! This app has all the things I could want in a mobile game. It can be mindless and soothing, or you can actually take the time to think through each move for a higher score.

It's patient and simple; each move is just a swipe, meaning I can pick it up or put it away in a matter of seconds. So few other games accomplish that.

I love the design and level of detail that has been poured into this game. I've owned it since it was released in 2014 and it's stood the test of time, needing very few updates in order to stay compatible with iOS.

According to the stats, I have played this game over 20,000 times. I wish I could buy it again!

title.label: 4 years later, still a daily game

content.label: Threes is calming and deceptively hard. I haven’t improved my score in about 2 years because as soon as I start it up, I zone out and relax. Maybe that sounds like a bad thing but it’s what keeps bringing me back to the game 4 years later. Worth every penny and then some. Thank you! (Someday I’ll play to win again . :)
I love this game. I’ve been playing it for years. It is challenging but addicting. Great game, highly recommend.
This is the game that was poorly ripped off by “2048.” Get this some to show your support for original ideas.

This game is the best, and I have played a ton of puzzle-ish games.  Stays endlessly fresh, managing details while also having good strategy. Getting to 1536, then 3072, then eventually to 6144-- each one was a major milestone that required me to learn new strategy to get there.  Fun to play fast or more slowly if you are a thoughtful type.
Easy to learn and a great way to pass the time.
This is my favorite game but the last few updates have made the app very sluggish. And I’m using as iPhone X.

title.label: One of the best puzzle games I’ve played

content.label: I’ve had threes on my phone for ages now and it is one of two games over a year old that I still pull out and play (Star Realms being the other).  A true classic!

title.label: My favorite and most played game

content.label: Legitimately the best puzzle game I’ve ever played. I’ve played it near daily for 3 years and keep seeing new things and getting better. Lots of charm with great puzzle gameplay. Download it for sure
Great game. Would be perfect if you could undo at least one move each game. Please consider adding that simple feature.

Very few games have made me as happy as threes. The concept is great, it is executed well, and theres so much personality packed into this simple numbers game that its impossible not to smile while playing. (Sound recommended!) 

Really not sure what all these negative reviews are about
This is far and away my most played game, and has been for years. Nothing makes a commute on DC Metro go faster.
I haven’t played this game in a year. I came back to it and couldn’t stop playing. I love that each tile as it’s own personality. The music is spot on.
I love love this game. It is my go to quick play game when I have a few minutes to kill!

I have played Three for years. Most times, playing Three to me is a way to relax and take my mind off things. Other times, it’s a way for me to power through boring meetings. 

Thank you for making such a beautiful game.

title.label: Seriously one of the best games on the App Store

content.label: Just buy it

The core of the game is just simple, challenging, accessible fun. I don’t play it as much as I did when I picked up years ago, but I still get plenty of mileage out of it on the train, etc. not many mobile games have that kind of endurance

Sometimes people just want to complain because they have a forum in which to do it, but not because they have anything worthwhile to say.  The negative reviews regarding Threes is an example of that.

This game is simple, challenging, and can fill hours of time if you allow yourself to get lost in the game.  It’s the perfect example of a game that doesn’t harangue you with in app purchases, and the complaints about a merchandise page are ridiculous since you can scroll past it in an instant.

This is a wonderful little gem that does not nickel and dime you for a great time.  Ignore the detractors, for their negative opinions on this game are not warranted at all.

Bored on the train? Got 5 minutes before your partner gets out of the shower? This is the perfect game to fill any short gap day of time in your day. The design is fantastic. The little characters are cute, and most importantly, the game is fun.

I’ve been having this game on my phone as the only game I have that I never deleted and been playing it everywhere for years since it first came out. It’s a really good game to kill time, sharpens your brains but in a simple way enough to relax, and it doesn’t require internet.
It’s already not that convenient to have a separate dedicated page for merchandise, but the algorithm change is what killed this game for any previous scores and unpreventable backlash.
Fun, challenging, simple. Stands the test of time.

title.label: A Smart, Gorgeous Puzzle Game With an Explosion of Personality

content.label: Highly recommended for lovely, 5 minute gaming sessions for all ages.
Good game that offers great puzzle experience

Frustrating game. You are expected to think ahead when playing, but there are too many inconsistencies. They say you can swipe slowly to preview a move, but many times there's no preview and you've taken a turn. Sometimes you can merge more than one set of tiles, other times not. Super annoying and impossible to plan. Slow to add your score. Nice idea but poorly executed.

Pretty good.  The gameplay is simple but engaging, challenging but fair.  The design is very clean and the music and sounds are pleasant.  There isn't a lot of variation, but I keep coming back for more.
